definition: to become a member/to join/to mix into/to participate in/to add in
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Anna Hu joined in as Group Business Director and other hires.
sentences.chinese: 胡曉雲加入擔任業務羣總監，還有一些新成員加盟。

sentences.english: We are looking for energetic candidates with good caliber to join Shanghai Representative Office.
sentences.chinese: 我們誠聘充滿活力及有才能的人士加入上海代表處。

sentences.english: This year we had twenty-seven young women enter.
sentences.chinese: 今年我們有27名年輕女性新加入。

sentences.english: Preferably the starting material is dissolved in methanol and a stoichiometric excess of ammonium hydroxide is added.
sentences.chinese: 原料最好溶解於甲醇並加入過量氫氧化銨。

sentences.english: The addition of steam inhibits the production of hydrogen cyanide.
sentences.chinese: 水蒸氣的加入會抑制氰化氫的產率。

sentences.english: Put the finely chopped shallots in a pan. Add the balsamic vinegar.
sentences.chinese: 把青蔥細末放入鍋裏，加入香草醋。

sentences.english: But just as quickly as new members come, they also go.
sentences.chinese: 隨着新成員的加入，老隊員也很快離去。

sentences.english: Guangzhou Fashion Exchange added credibility through.
sentences.chinese: 廣州時尚匯加入誠信通。

sentences.english: He only joined TMG in August 2005.
This is where Greece may come in.
sentences.chinese: 這也是希臘加入進來的原因。

sentences.english: Add this to the cabbage, carrots and apples evenly.
sentences.chinese: 然後在這裏面加入等量的紫甘藍，胡蘿蔔和蘋果。

sentences.english: My english performance is better than one day by one day since I joined HJ English.
sentences.chinese: 自從加入廬江之後，我的英語成績一天比一天好。

sentences.english: Tom's classmates wanted him to join the team when the season starts.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆的同學還要他在球季開始時加入球隊。

sentences.english: China joined into WTO, accompanying with the processes of Duha Round.
sentences.chinese: 中國加入WTO，同時也伴隨着多哈回合的歷程。

sentences.english: I want to play table-tennis. Do you want to join me ? No, I'm doing exercises.
sentences.chinese: 我想打乒乓球。你想加入我嗎？不，我正在做操。

definition: to add/to mix in/to incorporate
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
ranks/procession
to participate (in sth)
to bring in/to call in/to transfer (a person, data)/(computing) to call/to load (a subroutine etc)
to blend into/to integrate/to assimilate/to merge
to throw oneself into sth
to organize/to set up/to establish
team
along/together
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
Riga, capital of Latvia
member
in the same place/together/with/altogether (in total)
to participate/to take part/to join
group of people/camp/faction/sides in a dispute
